data.title: Get Current Census Data for Bridgeville, DE
data.meta_description: Need Bridgeville demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Bridgeville, DE from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 2,829 people, Bridgeville is the 35th most populated city in the state of Delaware out of 79 cities. But watch out, Bridgeville, because Greenville with 2,824 people and Riverview with 2,270 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Bridgeville racial/ethnic groups are White (60.5%) followed by Black (25.4%) and Hispanic (12.0%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Bridgeville households was $61,523. Bridgeville households made slightly more than Camden households ($60,549) and Long Neck households ($59,563) . However, 10.5% of Bridgeville families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Bridgeville residents is 57.3 years young.
